uk.ac.liv.util
Class CummulativeDistribution

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.liv.util.CummulativeDistribution
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Distribution, Resetable
Direct Known Subclasses:
HeavyweightDistribution
public class CummulativeDistribution
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Resetable, Distribution

A utility class for cummulative tracking of stats for a series of doubles. Moments are incremented dynamically, rather than keeping the actual cases in memory.

Example usage:

Distribution series1 = new CummulativeDistribution("series1");
series1.newData(4.5);
series1.newData(5.6);
series1.newData(9.0);
System.out.println("Standard deviation of series1 = " + series1.getStdDev());
series1.newData(5.56);
series1.newData(12);
System.out.println("And now the standard deviation = " + series1.getStdDev());

Version:
$Revision$
Author:
Steve Phelps
See Also:

getTrimmedMean

public double getTrimmedMean(double p)
Description copied from interface: Distribution
Get the symetrically trimmed mean of the data. If p is zero then this is equivalent to the mean. If p is 0.5 then this equivalent to the median.

Specified by:
getTrimmedMean in interface Distribution
Parameters:
p - The proportion of the distribution to trim from each side.
